metadata.title: AI-Enhanced ML-FAANG Mastery Plan
metadata.description: 20-week comprehensive roadmap for ML researchers transitioning to FAANG software engineering roles with AI-powered learning assistance

week.title: Portfolio Showcase & Technical Leadership
objectives: Finalize and polish 3-4 key portfolio projects for FAANG interviews
Develop compelling narratives and presentations for each project
Demonstrate technical leadership and deep system understanding
Master technical communication for diverse audiences (engineers, PMs, leadership)
Practice advanced problem-solving connecting theory to production systems

morning_session.title: Project Narrative & Architecture Review
activities: Select primary portfolio project for deep-dive presentation
Use AI to draft a compelling story: problem, solution, impact
Create high-level architecture diagrams with AI assistance

problems.name: Design Phone Directory
problems.description: System design with efficient resource management

problems.name: Design In-Memory File System
problems.description: Complex system design with hierarchical structure

problems.name: Single Number
problems.ai_prompt: How does XOR relate to error correction in distributed ML systems?

problems.name: Missing Number
problems.description: Find missing number using bit manipulation
problems.ai_prompt: How does missing data detection relate to data quality in ML?

problems.name: Counting Bits
problems.ai_prompt: How does bit counting relate to sparse representation in ML?

evening_session.title: Code Refinement & Documentation
activities: Refactor project code for clarity and production-readiness
Write comprehensive README using AI for structure and grammar
Plan technical blog post outline for the project

morning_session.title: Technical Presentation Crafting
activities: Create a slide deck for your primary project presentation
Use AI to generate visuals and talking points for each slide
Practice delivering the first half of the presentation with AI feedback

problems.name: The Skyline Problem
problems.description: Complex geometric problem with sweep-line algorithm

problems.name: Smallest Range Covering Elements from K Lists

evening_session.title: Presentation Polish & Peer Review Prep
activities: Record a full run-through of your project presentation
Use AI tools to analyze your speech for clarity, pacing, and filler words
Prepare questions for a mock peer review session

morning_session.title: Communicating Innovation & Trade-offs
activities: Refine project presentation to highlight innovative aspects
Practice explaining complex technical trade-offs in simple terms
Use AI to role-play a Q&A session with a non-technical stakeholder

problems.name: Remove Invalid Parentheses
problems.description: BFS with state pruning and optimization

evening_session.title: Mock Peer Review
activities: Present your project to a peer or use an AI persona for feedback
Focus on defending design choices and explaining the 'why'
Incorporate feedback into your presentation and README

morning_session.title: Demonstrating Technical Depth
activities: Prepare 3 deep-dive topics related to your project (e.g., why a specific DB, algorithm choice, performance tuning)
Use AI to generate challenging questions about your deep-dive topics
Practice answering deep-dive questions concisely and accurately

evening_session.title: Final Project Polish
activities: Create a short video demo of your main portfolio project
Ensure all project links (GitHub, live demo) are working
Write a concise, impactful summary for each project on your resume

morning_session.title: Company-Specific Research
activities: Research the tech stacks of 2-3 target FAANG companies
Use AI to find recent engineering blogs or publications from those companies
Tailor your project narratives to align with their work and values

problems.name: Find Median from Data Stream
problems.description: Commonly asked, relates to real-time analytics

evening_session.title: Week 17 Prep & Final Review
activities: Review all portfolio materials one last time
Prepare for mock interviews in Week 17
Use AI to generate a checklist for interview readiness

saturday.title: Portfolio Project: Live Demo & Defense
saturday.description: Simulate a portfolio review session. Present one of your key projects to a panel (peers or AI personas) and defend your technical decisions. The goal is to demonstrate ownership, deep understanding, and strong communication skills under pressure.
tasks: Deliver a 20-minute presentation on your project.
Field 30 minutes of deep-dive questions from your review panel.
Whiteboard a potential extension or improvement to your system.
Use AI to get feedback on your performance and identify areas for improvement.
saturday.deliverable: A recording of your presentation and a document summarizing the feedback received and your action items.

sunday.title: Behavioral Interview Prep for Technical Leaders
sunday.description: Focus on behavioral questions tailored for senior/leadership roles. Use the STAR (Situation, Task, Action, Result) method to structure compelling stories about your past projects and experiences, emphasizing your leadership, impact, and decision-making process.
tasks: Draft 5 detailed STAR stories based on your portfolio projects.
Use AI to refine your stories for maximum impact and clarity.
Practice answering common behavioral questions with an AI mock interviewer.
Prepare questions to ask your interviewers that demonstrate your technical curiosity and leadership potential.
sunday.deliverable: A document containing 5 polished STAR stories ready for interviews.
